intro: Epilobium × acidulum, commonly known as sticky willow or silverweed, is a flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and disturbed areas. Epilobium × acidulum is known for its sticky hairs on the stems and leaves, which give it its common name.
